subject: AI
title: Observability & Tracing
description: Logging and monitoring every step of an agent's execution.

hook.text: An agent gave a wrong answer to a customer. Your boss asks: 'What happened?' Without tracing, you have no idea which tool it called, what it retrieved, or why it decided that.

buildup.text: Agent observability means logging every step: each LLM call (prompt + response), each tool invocation (input + output), each decision point, and the final result.

discovery.text: Tools like LangSmith, Langfuse, and Arize let you trace agent runs end-to-end. Each run becomes a tree of steps you can inspect, replay, and debug.

twist.text: Tracing also reveals cost and performance: which steps are slow? Which tools fail most? Where are tokens wasted? Observability drives optimisation.

climax.text: Production agents without observability are black boxes. With tracing, every failure becomes a learning opportunity, and every success can be replicated.

punchline.text: You can't fix what you can't see. Trace everything.

quiz.question: What does agent tracing help you debug?
options: Each step: LLM calls, tool invocations, decisions, and results
